<<<<<<< HEAD
Capt. Johnsons last farewel; who was arraigned for being assisting in the stealing a young heiress, for which he received sentance [sic] of death, and was accordingly executed at Tyburn, the 23d. of this instant December, 1690. To the tune of Russel's farewel. Licensed according to order. Johnston, John, Sir, d. 1690.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : music.
Printed for Charles Bates, at the Bible and Sun in Pye-corner., [London] : [1690?]
Place and date of publication from Wing. Verse: "You noble lords of high degree ..." Printed in two columns. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
